generated_body: In the article titled "What happens in your body when you sneeze?", the user can expect a detailed explanation of the physiological processes involved in sneezing. This may include descriptions of the triggers that lead to a sneeze, such as irritants in the nasal passages, and the subsequent reactions of the respiratory system. The article is likely to clarify how sneezing serves as a protective mechanism for the body, helping to expel foreign particles. Additionally, it could touch on the role of reflexes and the impact of sneezing on overall health.
